moves.1. d4: every once in a while, we need to shut up the critics; that is why I tend not to decline all challenges with 1. d4...
moves.1... d5 2. c4 Bf5 3. cxd5: not the best of choices here... we usually play Nc3...
moves.3... Bxb1 4. Rxb1: better first Qa4+, c6, and then Rxb1...
moves.4... Qxd5 5. b3 Qe4 6. Bb2 e5: the sudden threat of Bb4+ disrupts whites' play... the fierce Queen in the center is becoming a problem...
moves.7. a3 exd4 8. f3: not the best way, to lose that Queen... and Bxd4, Nc6 looks nasty, after 0-0-0...
moves.8... Qg6 9. Rc1 Nc6 10. b4 Rd8 11. Qd3 Q: for some reason, black did not trust Nf6, Nf4, Re5+, Ne2, a5... this clears all up...
moves.14. bxa5 Kd7 15. Rc4 Bd6 16. Nxd4: white is losing his patience, along with control...
another inaccuracy... better d4, Bxa3, Nd3, Be6, g3...
moves.19... Ne7 20. Bh3+ f5 21. O-O Rxa3 22. R: Rf4, Rb2, Nc2, Nd5, Rxf5, Bd4+ would have save a lot of damage...
moves.23... Bd4+ 24. Kh1 c5 25. Na2 Rha8 26. N: white breaks under the pressure... best try was Re4, Nxf3, Re6+, Kc7, Rc6+, Kd8, Rc8+, Ke7, Rc7+, Kd6, Rd7+, Ke5, Bb1 and sit it out...
moves.35... Rdf2+: white resigns... Kg1, Nxf3+, Kh1, Rxh2 mates...
